properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 3 at 5:20AM EST until January 4 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...Forecast Flooding Changed from Minor to Moderate Severity for the
following rivers in Georgia...

Lookout Creek near New England affecting Dade and Hamilton
Counties


.Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant runoff into streams and
rivers which will cause flooding in some areas.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Lookout Creek near New England.
* Until Saturday afternoon.
* At 5 AM Friday the stage was 16.6 feet and rising.
* Minor flooding is occurring, however, moderate flooding is forecast
to develop.
* Flood stage is 12 feet.
* The creek will continue rising, reaching near 17.5 feet by this
afternoon. The creek will fall below flood stage Saturday morning.
* Between 16 and 17 feet, minor flooding expands along Sells Lane in
Trenton, Mason Road near Rising Fawn and Creek Road near New
England. These roads and other roads with creeks flowing into
Lookout Creek will flood causing the roads to be closed. The water
will be a few feet deep on portions of these roads. Also minor
flooding will continue to expand downstream as the creek crosses
the Tennessee border into the Tiftona area.

At 17 feet, moderate flooding begins with several small buildings
near the New England hang gliding recreation park beginning to
flood. Several roads in Dade county will be closed including Sells
Lane, Mason Road and Creek Road with water several feet deep on
portions of these roads. Also, moderate flooding will begin
downstream as the creek crosses the Tennessee border into the
Tiftona area. Several roads near the creek will be flooded and
closed.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interests along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...and be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property.

The latest stage data was furnished in cooperation with the United
States Geological Survey.

NWSheadline: Forecast flooding increased from Minor to Moderate severity
